intro: Peristylus albidus, commonly known as the white peristylus, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in late spring. Its leaves are finely divided and have a mild, spicy fragrance. Peristylus albidus is often grown in gardens for its ornamental value and historical use in traditional medicine.
